verses.kjv: And when king Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the south, heard tell that Israel came by the way of the spies; then he fought against Israel, and took some of them prisoners.
verses.web: The Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the South, heard that Israel came by the way of Atharim. He fought against Israel, and took some of them captive.
verses.ct: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the southern region, heard that Israel was approaching by the way of Atharim. He attacked the Israelites and captured some of them.

verses.kjv: And Israel vowed a vow unto the LORD, and said, If thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.
verses.web: Israel vowed a vow to LORD, and said, “If you will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.”
verses.ct: So Israel made a vow to the LORD: "If you hand these people over to us, we will completely destroy their cities."

verses.kjv: And the LORD hearkened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities: and he called the name of the place Hormah.
verses.web: LORD listened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities. The name of the place was called Hormah.
verses.ct: The LORD listened to Israel's plea and handed the Canaanites over to them. The Israelites completely destroyed them and their cities, so the place was named Hormah.

verses.kjv: And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea, to compass the land of Edom: and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way.
verses.web: They traveled from Mount Hor by the way to the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom. The soul of the people was very discouraged because of the journey.
verses.ct: They set out from Mount Hor along the road toward the Red Sea, going around the land of Edom. The people grew deeply discouraged because of the long journey.

verses.kjv: And the people spake against God, and against Moses, Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loatheth this light bread.
verses.web: The people spoke against God and against Moses: “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no bread, there is no water, and our soul loathes this disgusting food!”
verses.ct: They began to complain against God and against Moses: "Why did you bring us out of Egypt just to die in this wilderness? There's no bread, there's no water, and we're sick of this miserable food!"

verses.kjv: And the LORD sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and much people of Israel died.
verses.web: LORD sent venomous snakes among the people, and they bit the people. Many people of Israel died.
verses.ct: So the LORD sent venomous snakes among the people. The snakes bit them, and many Israelites died.

verses.kjv: Therefore the people came to Moses, and said, We have sinned, for we have spoken against the LORD, and against thee; pray unto the LORD, that he take away the serpents from us. And Moses prayed for the people.
verses.web: The people came to Moses, and said, “We have sinned, because we have spoken against LORD and against you. Pray to LORD, that he take away the serpents from us.” Moses prayed for the people.
verses.ct: The people came to Moses and said, "We have sinned by speaking against the LORD and against you. Please pray to the LORD to take these snakes away from us." So Moses prayed for the people.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Make thee a fiery serpent, and set it upon a pole: and it shall come to pass, that every one that is bitten, when he looketh upon it, shall live.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Make a venomous snake, and set it on a pole. It shall happen that everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live.”
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Make a snake and mount it on a pole. Anyone who has been bitten can look at it and live."

verses.kjv: And Moses made a serpent of brass, and put it upon a pole, and it came to pass, that if a serpent had bitten any man, when he beheld the serpent of brass, he lived.
verses.web: Moses made a serpent of bronze, and set it on the pole. If a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked at the serpent of bronze, he lived.
verses.ct: So Moses made a bronze snake and mounted it on a pole. Whenever someone was bitten by a snake, they would look at the bronze snake and survive.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel set forward, and pitched in Oboth.
verses.web: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in Oboth.
verses.ct: The Israelites moved on and set up camp at Oboth.

verses.kjv: And they journeyed from Oboth, and pitched at Ijeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrising.
verses.web: They traveled from Oboth, and encamped at Iyeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrise.
verses.ct: From Oboth they traveled and set up camp at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness east of Moab, toward the sunrise.

verses.kjv: From thence they removed, and pitched in the valley of Zared.
verses.web: From there they traveled, and encamped in the valley of Zered.
verses.ct: From there they moved on and set up camp in the valley of Zared.

verses.kjv: From thence they removed, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wilderness that cometh out of the coasts of the Amorites: for Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
verses.web: From there they traveled, and encamped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the border of the Amorites; for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
verses.ct: They moved on again and set up camp on the far side of the Arnon River, in the wilderness that extends from Amorite territory. The Arnon serves as the border between Moab and the Amorites.

verses.kjv: Wherefore it is said in the book of the wars of the LORD, What he did in the Red sea, and in the brooks of Arnon,
verses.web: Therefore it is said in the book of the Wars of LORD, “Vaheb in Suphah, the valleys of the Arnon,
verses.ct: This is why the Book of the Wars of the LORD mentions "Vaheb in Suphah and the valleys of the Arnon,

verses.kjv: And at the stream of the brooks that goeth down to the dwelling of Ar, and lieth upon the border of Moab.
verses.web: the slope of the valleys that incline toward the dwelling of Ar, leans on the border of Moab.”
verses.ct: and the slopes of the valleys that stretch toward the settlement of Ar and lean against the border of Moab."

verses.kjv: And from thence they went to Beer: that is the well whereof the LORD spake unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.
verses.web: From there they traveled to Beer; that is the well of which LORD said to Moses, “Gather the people together, and I will give them water.”
verses.ct: From there they traveled to Beer — that's the well where the LORD told Moses, "Gather the people together, and I will give them water."

verses.kjv: Then Israel sang this song, Spring up, O well; sing ye unto it:
verses.web: Then Israel sang this song: “Spring up, well! Sing to it,
verses.ct: That's when Israel sang this song: "Spring up, O well! Sing to it!

verses.kjv: The princes digged the well, the nobles of the people digged it, by the direction of the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah:
verses.web: the well, which the princes dug, which the nobles of the people dug, with the scepter, and with their poles.” From the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah;
verses.ct: This well was dug by princes — the nobles of the people dug it with their scepters and their staffs." From the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah,

verses.kjv: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel: and from Nahaliel to Bamoth:
verses.web: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth;
verses.ct: from Mattanah to Nahaliel, from Nahaliel to Bamoth,

verses.kjv: And from Bamoth in the valley, that is in the country of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looketh toward Jeshimon.
verses.web: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the field of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looks down on the desert.
verses.ct: and from Bamoth to the valley in the territory of Moab, near the top of Pisgah, which overlooks the desert below.

verses.kjv: And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.web: Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.ct: Israel sent messengers to Sihon, king of the Amorites, with this request:

verses.kjv: Let me pass through thy land: we will not turn into the fields, or into the vineyards; we will not drink of the waters of the well: but we will go along by the king’s high way, until we be past thy borders.
verses.web: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn away into field or vineyard. We will not drink of the water of the wells. We will go by the king’s highway, until we have passed your border.”
verses.ct: "Let us pass through your land. We won't go through any fields or vineyards, and we won't drink water from your wells. We'll stay on the king's highway until we've crossed your territory."

verses.kjv: And Sihon would not suffer Israel to pass through his border: but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness: and he came to Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
verses.web: Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his border, but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and came to Jahaz. He fought against Israel.
verses.ct: But Sihon refused to let Israel pass through his territory. Instead, he assembled his entire army and marched out into the wilderness to confront Israel. He reached Jahaz and attacked them.

verses.kjv: And Israel smote him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from Arnon unto Jabbok, even unto the children of Ammon: for the border of the children of Ammon was strong.
verses.web: Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, even to the children of Ammon; for the border of the children of Ammon was fortified.
verses.ct: Israel defeated him by the sword and took possession of his land from the Arnon River to the Jabbok River, all the way to the Ammonite border, which was heavily fortified.

verses.kjv: And Israel took all these cities: and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all the villages thereof.
verses.web: Israel took all these cities. Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its villages.
verses.ct: Israel captured all the Amorite cities and settled in them, including Heshbon and all its surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even unto Arnon.
verses.web: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even to the Arnon.
verses.ct: Heshbon had been the capital of Sihon, king of the Amorites. He had previously gone to war against the former king of Moab and seized all his territory as far as the Arnon.

verses.kjv: Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared:
verses.web: Therefore those who speak in proverbs say, “Come to Heshbon. Let the city of Sihon be built and established;
verses.ct: That's why the poets say: "Come to Heshbon! Let the city of Sihon be rebuilt and restored!

verses.kjv: For there is a fire gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon: it hath consumed Ar of Moab, and the lords of the high places of Arnon.
verses.web: for a fire has gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon. It has devoured Ar of Moab, The lords of the high places of the Arnon.
verses.ct: For fire blazed out from Heshbon, a flame from Sihon's city. It consumed Ar of Moab and devoured the rulers of Arnon's heights.

verses.kjv: Woe to thee, Moab! thou art undone, O people of Chemosh: he hath given his sons that escaped, and his daughters, into captivity unto Sihon king of the Amorites.
verses.web: Woe to you, Moab! You are undone, people of Chemosh! He has given his sons as fugitives, and his daughters into captivity, to Sihon king of the Amorites.
verses.ct: How terrible for you, Moab! You are destroyed, people of Chemosh! Your god let his sons become fugitives and his daughters become captives of Sihon, king of the Amorites.

verses.kjv: We have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah, which reacheth unto Medeba.
verses.web: We have shot at them. Heshbon has perished even to Dibon. We have laid waste even to Nophah, Which reaches to Medeba.”
verses.ct: We struck them down! Heshbon is ruined all the way to Dibon. We laid waste to everything as far as Nophah, which stretches to Medeba."

verses.kjv: Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.
verses.web: Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
verses.ct: So Israel settled in the land of the Amorites.

verses.kjv: And Moses sent to spy out Jaazer, and they took the villages thereof, and drove out the Amorites that were there.
verses.web: Moses sent to spy out Jazer. They took its villages, and drove out the Amorites who were there.
verses.ct: Moses sent scouts to Jazer. The Israelites captured its villages and drove out the Amorites living there.

verses.kjv: And they turned and went up by the way of Bashan: and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he, and all his people, to the battle at Edrei.
verses.web: They turned and went up by the way of Bashan. Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verses.ct: Then they turned and headed up the road toward Bashan. Og, king of Bashan, marched out with his entire army to fight them at Edrei.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Fear him not: for I have delivered him into thy hand, and all his people, and his land; and thou shalt do to him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Don’t fear him, for I have delivered him into your hand, with all his people, and his land. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.”
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Don't be afraid of him. I have handed him over to you — him, all his people, and his land. Do to him exactly what you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon."

verses.kjv: So they smote him, and his sons, and all his people, until there was none left him alive: and they possessed his land.
verses.web: So they struck him, with his sons and all his people, until there were no survivors; and they possessed his land.
verses.ct: So they struck down Og, his sons, and all his people, leaving no survivors. Then they took possession of his land.
